descriptions.content:
These very common particles have the same meaning as imperatives formed with the verb alone, or formed with རོགས་གནང་, but refer to a lower register. In conversation they are pronounced respectively da and sh. They may be used with both honorific and non-honorific forms.

  • གསུངས་དང་། “Say it.”
  • ཕེབས་དང་། “Go.”
  • ཕེབས་ཤིག “Go.”
  • བཞུགས་ཤིག “Sit down.”
  • བཞུགས་དང་། “Sit down.”
  • ཟོ་དང་། “Eat.”
  • ཉོན་དང་། “Listen.”
  • ལབ་དང་། “Speak.”
  • ལྟོས་ཤིག “Look.”
